message.content:
cs.CR, cs.GT, cs.SY, cs.AI, cs.SE

The paper discusses a game-theoretic approach to optimizing the timing of moving target defense (MTD) to better protect a system from persistent threats. This involves jointly optimizing the spatial and temporal decisions in MTD, which suggests a focus on security (cs.CR) and optimization (cs.GT) sub-categories. The use of a Stackelberg game model also suggests a focus on game theory (cs.GT) and control systems (cs.SY). Additionally, the paper proposes a semi-Markovian decision process to formulate the defender's problem, which suggests a focus on artificial intelligence (cs.AI) and software engineering (cs.SE) sub-categories.
